Summary: Save yourself the worry and go somewhere else. This is your typical hooker & druggy motel with long term renters. Roaches climbing up the wall all night, visible water damage , smelled of mildew, ac didn’t work, just gross. Saving a buck ain’t worth it especially when you can’t sleep because you’re counting roaches and in fear of drug addicts continuously knocking on your door looking for the dealer.
Manager Response: Dear guest We regret that despite our efforts to make a good impression of our property during your recent stay we were unsuccessful. Please contact property General Manager regarding this issue as we’ll like to open a case on this part. Best Regards.

Summary: no towels were given on any day. no cleaning service.  first room smelled so musty and had black mold on the ceiling of the shower.  bad news had people living there long term.  the next room was better no musty smell but worn out and beds were so cheap and uncomfortable.  very bad stay.  is being renovated so maybe in a year or two try it out.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback.  We were disappointed to learn that the condition of our hotel did not meet your expectations. Please be assured that this is not the standard that we aspire to and we will share your concerns with the appropriate members of our team moving forward.  We hope you allow us the chance to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: Had to stay in Tustin for four days, so I picked the cheapest hotel I could find. I would have found a hostel if they had any in Tustin, but this was the only option. "How bad could it be?" I asked myself. The hotel answered my question pretty quick. Not only did the room smell weird, the carpets were greasy and my socks became black within just a few minutes of walking around. Trash and smashed glass(?) at the poolside. Oh, speaking of the poolside, my card refused to work on the pool gate, someone had to let me in. The water was dirty.  All in all, a little self vacation turned out to be a practice in patience and self-denial.

This is the worst hotel I have ever spent my night in. The rooms stink, a very dump, stale  smell and yet they are supposed to me "smoke free". Better smoke than that awful smell which was coming from them. I have jitters when I remember this hotel's condition.  I do not think the dark carpet has ever been washed, it made my clean feet black-greenish-no wonder they put dark carpets. I tried to put socks and within minutes they were terribly dark. The blankets and bed covers are dark brownish-you know why? To camouflage the dirt, stain and smell. On the hallways it is like we have some people who pee there, there were long dry stinky stain. Many of people who dwell and visit this hotel looks like they were under influence of something. Unless I got the worst of the worst rooms,
Room tip: They gave me a wifi code but I did not dare to use it because of the terrible, awful conditions...
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, PMIRU.  It's unfortunate your time with us was less than ideal. We care about the satisfaction and happiness of our guests. We regret that your room wasn't refreshed properly. It's important to us that we offer our guests a quality experience so we'll address your concerns with the appropriate members of our team moving forward.  We hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: Trash. They told me it was quiet, non-smoking, and a nice place. I came from out of town for an exam and wanted to stay in a quiet place to study for my exam the next day. People yelled at each other about adult issues (hint: not kid-friendly), played music during the night, a crazy guy shook my door in the middle of the night, people smoked outside, the shower drain didn't work, the sheets were dirty, and the toilet had pubic hair on it. I wanted to get another hotel but it was too late. Thanks to the loud neighbors, I didn’t get a wink of sleep for that very expensive exam. The lady on the phone said: “she would let her daughter stay there and it was safe and quiet.” I would NEVER let any family or friend stay there. I didn’t feel safe parking my car there or being alone
Manager Response: Dear guest,  We are deeply sorry that you had such of terrible stay with us. Rest assure that we’ll continue to improve our facility in the different aspects needed to make it more a more nicer place. Thank you for giving us the opportunity of having you as our guest. Best Regards.

Summary: They charged us $90 for a room that was overpriced at $50. Room stank of stale smoke.  Dirty carpet, dirty walls, no amenities, loose fixtures, plugs that do not work, shabby hole ridden doors and a place in serious need of painting.  You’d be better off pitching a tent and camping in Denny’s parking lot!
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback!  It's unfortunate your stay in our hotel didn't exceed your expectations. We regret you weren't entirely satisfied with our furnishings and accommodations. We care deeply about the happiness and satisfaction of our guests so we'll address all of your concerns with our team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary Heading: Right next to I-5 freeway (noisy) and "non-smoking" room stank of cig. smoke
Summary: Our room (428) was, at our request, toward the rear of the property, so it was a bit removed from the loud freeway, but it was not exactly silent. The room was small but clean. The main issue was that it reeked of stale cigarette smoke even though it was a designated "no smoking" room. When I phoned the front desk about this problem, the young lady told me "It's supposed to be non-smoking, but we don't catch everybody who smokes. Just turn on the air conditioner." Since it was late and the parking lot was crowded, I assumed that there were few if any other rooms available and I didn't ask for a different room. Suffice it to say that turning on the A/C didn't help with the smell. This room would have been disappointing had it been a roadside room in a rural area for which I paid
Room tip: Get a room as far away from the freeway as possible.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback.  We're deeply disappointed you had such challenges during your time with us. We regret that your room wasn't refreshed properly. We hold ourselves to a much higher standard so we'll address your concerns with our team to help us rectify these problems moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: Customer service was great, and location made sense for our vacation.  However, temper hour expectations for the Key Inn.  We were greeted by questionable activities going on at the hotel by other patrons.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback.  We deeply regret the challenges you had during your time with us. The security and safety of our guests is of the utmost importance so we're disheartened that you had such problems. We hold ourselves to a much higher standard of service so we'll be sure to address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: Needed a one night stay for a good price. Stayed here, though the staff was nice, my room was right next to where several locals were living at the hotel.  The cars, people sitting outside of their rooms watching and the area made me nervous for my self and my nice vehicle.  The room was much older but clean. I didn't sleep well at all due to my nervousness. I won't even consider staying here any further
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback, Roxy.  We deeply regret the challenges you had during your time with us. The security and safety of our guests is of the utmost importance so we're disheartened that you had such problems. We hold ourselves to a much higher standard of service so we'll be sure to address all of your concerns with the appropriate members of our team so we may improve moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: Stayed here for one night on our way to Newport Beach.  In our room, the sink stopper did not work.  Had to put a wash cloth over the sink so we wouldn't loose a contact. Many of the rooms are rented out to long term renters. Maybe the hotel has a deal with the city?? Anyway, there were quit a few people just milling about at night time and had to go through many smokers to get to room.   Not a secure feeling. Be sure to lock your car if you stay here. Will not be returning EVER and I'm surprised Booking.Com even lists this property.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback, BeckCalifornia.  We regret that you had such difficulty during your time with us. We strive to offer quality service and comfort for our guests and it's unfortunate your room wasn't cleaned to the high standards we aspire to provide. We'll be sure to address your feedback with our team moving forward.  We do hope you allow us to host you again soon so we can share a more positive experience with you.

Summary: I booked this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. When I first arrived here around the morning, the staff already checked me in. She was very friendly and nice to let me check in early than 2p. I was so impressed about my checking in. The room I had was a deluxe room with a queen size bed. When I walked in my room, I couldn’t open the door because there was a problem with the door light. So the staff switched me to another room. And then, this room have a double twin beds but still I wasn’t happy with it because there was a cockroach on the table. And I told the staff about it so I got switched to another room which was on the 2nd building and way too far from the office. So I stayed In that room but I couldn’t sleep at all. Because someone kept banging on the wall outside of the
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, Cali.  We strive to offer our guests quality service and comfort. We're glad our team was able to accommodate you. However, it's unfortunate that your stay with us was anything less than perfect. We'll be addressing your concerns with the appropriate members of our team.  We'd love to see you again in the future to share a more positive experience with you.

Summary Heading: Solid 2-star motel.  Good value for the basic amenities.
Summary: Pros: Location -- Less than 50 feet from 24-hour restaurant Denny's.  One side faces the 5 Freeway; light sleepers need to request for rooms not facing the 5 Freeway.  5-minute walk to small strip shopping area that includes Stater Bros supermarket and mom-and-pop eateries.  Reception Desk -- There were two staff during my check-in on Monday 6pm, and both were attentive, such that the check-ins were expeditious.  Friday morning checkout took all of 5 minutes.  Hospitality/Maintenance Staff -- Quick response.  I asked for an extra pillow because there were only two in the room, and the cable TV signal was erratic.  The maintenance man was at my room within 10 minutes of my call for service, and pillow delivery.  Facility -- The grounds were kept clean.  I saw staff sweeping the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate the feedback. While we're happy you appreciated our attentive service and clean facilities, it's unfortunate our accommodations didn't meet your expectations. We regret your challenges and inconvenience so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: Rooms are smal, poorly lit (always mission at least one lightbulb in the lamps) and the people that frequent the hotel and surrounding area are interesting to say the least.  Make sure you lock your car. N
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback, Morgan.  We're disappointed that your stay with us was anything less than ideal. It's unfortunate you've noticed a decline in the quality of our accommodations. We care about the comfort of our guests so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We hope for the opportunity to host you again soon for a more positive experience.

Summary: The motel is handy to I5.   So handy in fact the noise drowns out everything else.   I needed a place at short notice and booked here.  Friendly and efficient check in.  Room 119 on ground floor.  One queen and one single bed.  Refrigerator and private bath.   The room did smell fusty but a blast of the powerful air con unit soon banished that.  Room was clean. Beds comfy. Shower good and plenty hot water and clean towels.   Pretty basic motel, I suspect it has permanent residents living there amongst the passing trade but for the price it did the job.  Done expect much and you’ll be ok.
Manager Response: We appreciate the feedback, Tom.  We're disappointed you had such challenges during your time with us. We regret the problems you had with the sound levels in the rooms and that your stay didn't exceed your expectations. We care about the comfort of our guests so we'll address your concerns with our team moving forward.  We do hope you give us another opportunity to share a more positive experience with you soon.

Summary: The rooms are clean and the place is kept up. I have stayed in places that charged much more then didn't deliver on the level of quality of this place. No bed bugs, no cockroaches, rooms are fairly sound proof as I never heard any neighbors. And for less then $65 a night.
Manager Response: Thanks for the 4-star rating and review, Gregory!  We're thrilled you had such a pleasant time with us! We strive to offer top-notch service and convenience for our guests. It's fantastic you enjoyed our quality of service as well as our pricing so much. That's what we like to see!  We look forward to sharing an even better experience with you next time. Have a lovely day!

Summary: This was the nastiest place we have ever been. YUKK ... We requested non-smoking, it was dingy, smoky, stinky, the bed had a plastic wrap on it.  So gross ... we never took our shoes off.  We think it's a short term (maybe long term) rental place for transients.  We did not feel safe, but we were only staying one night.  We had already paid and we were on a budget and no extra money for a new hotel.   FYI: The office was 2-3 blocks away in a completely different property.  DO NOT STAY HERE!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to leave us this feedback, Bren.  We regret that you had such difficulty during your time with us. We strive to offer quality service and comfort for our guests and it's unfortunate your room wasn't cleaned to the high standards we aspire to provide. We'll be sure to address your feedback with our team moving forward.  We do hope you allow us to host you again soon so we can share a more positive experience with you.

Summary: Not good if you are going to stay with your family. Other residents were drinking and smoking in their porches...car parking was not good...most of the time I was worried that my car should be safe...!! No breakfast...No coffee...!!!

I was greeted by a number of, obviously, long-term residents drinking beer on their "porches" & tinkering with cars that hadn't run during the last 2 administrations. Things only got better when i went into my room to find the most uncomfortable, work out, bed covered (barely) by a single sheet well passed it's prime with cigarette burns in both the blanket (thinner than the sheet) and the chair. If the floor had been washed or the carpet vacuumed it was not recently. Beyond that, the differed maintenance on the building showed the owners care only about the current cash flow. Do yourself a favor & stay anywhere else.

Summary Heading: Dirty, Sticky.  Smells like Vomit.  Not safe for families.
Summary: I got to my 2nd floor room on a Sunday afternoon for a 1-night stay.  I got the room because it was cheap ($54/night from Priceline), 2-STAR rating and close to Irvine.  Unfortunately, Priceline lied about the 2-STAR rating.  Key Inn seem to house like long-term monthly and homeless-voucher residents.  They have half-naked individuals displayed through their wide open doors -- maybe waiting for customers??  lol.     BAD:  The hallways and my room smells like vomit.  Carpet was dirty and sticky.  Even though it was suppose to be non-smoking, the room smelled like cigarettes.  Air conditioning didn't work.  Hot water was barely warm.  No toilet paper.    GOOD:  Two clean towels.  Cable TV and WIFI works.      Priceline should have given this motel a ZERO star.

Walls are paper thin and the beds aren't very comfortable but you get what you pay for.  Average motel.  Nothing special.  The sheets were clean so that's a positive.  There's a Denny's right next door for breakfast convenience.

This place smells like urine. Everyone has their doors open because all the rooms stink. Phone doesn't work to call the office. It was unplugged and there wasn't even a place to plug it in. Don't waste your money here!!!

It's a fairly priced places to stay, conveniently located right off the 5 fwy at Redhill with a Dennys within 500 yards and right behind a little strip mall with a big lots and coin laundry mat and smoke shop. The place has water bugs (cockroaches without the fear of lights) near the plantation on the bottom floors but upstairs I had minimal bug sightings. The staff was friendly and moved me from room to room and offered assistance from their staff which was appreciated. Overall the staff and their willing to help and cheerful greetings made the stay worthwhile but it's a little busy after dark with questionable characters - but they do have a security man that does a fair job at running off loiterers.   Biggest complaint is they do not have a deadbolt or some sort of latch

Family trip to Disneyland and CA Adventure. Easy to get to off the 5 with plenty of restaurants a walk away. Area is sketchy but no problem for my family. First thing we noticed was the back battery plate of the TV remote was missing so batteries kept popping out. TV channels were out so we called the front desk and first time we met Chris, the handyman/maintenance. He knew exactly what to do meaning it happens often. TV worked for the night, I saw what he did so I fixed it the next few times. My 2 year old wanted to eat microwavable noodles, I put them in and noticed the inside of the microwave was burnt. Called front desk they sent Chris with a brand new one still unopened in the box. Chris set it up and left, I placed the noodles in and set the timer. The microwave started

I stayed here for 2 nights since I was going to Disneyland and DCA. The room smelled like smoke even though it said was non smoking. The microwave didn't work so we got a brand new one and that one didn't work either. The maintenance guy named Chris was very helpful. He fixed everything we had a problem with including the TV. The area around this hotel is kinda ghetto so be careful. There's a Dennys next door which is a plus and a big lots around the corner. All in all it was ok but I wouldn't stay here again.

My needs: a cheap one-nighter, where I wouldn't really be in the room long, just a short night of sleep. The good: the front desk was nice and helpful, and the room was clean The bad: in need of major upgrade to the bed. Mattress was very saggy. And the room/bathroom in general needed an upgrade. A motel in the truest sense of the word. It is beside the busy highway. I requested a room away from the highway side, otherwise, I'm sure noise would have been a problem.  I wouldn't want to stay here more than one night. But it was fine for what I needed. A quick sleep before moving on.

We made the mistake of booking 1 Thursday night here when we needed to have our house tented for termites. We were new to the area, and our house is in a nice neighborhood about 1 mile away.  We thought it would be most convenient to take the kids to  school from here, then we planned to go out of town after school ended Friday afternoon.   MISTAKE.   This place is a dump. Totally seedy. Totally sketchy people here. The room was GROSS, with thin walls and who knows what kooties on the surfaces. I've never regretted a hotel decision more and wished I would have booked at the Marriott just 2 miles away.  If you're looking for a dumpy motel because you're despondent or depressed, this is an appropriate venue from which to drown your sorrows. Heck, it might make you feel better

Summary Heading: Ok if you are a guy
Summary: a room and a bed for cheap - guys, don't ever take your wife here...this is a place where you can crash for cheap, safe, fairly clean and hot shower.  Rooms were good size, a little freeway noise but not bothersome...easy to get to and get back on the I=5.

Summary Heading: Dusty, thin walls, sketchy neighborhood, cheap
Summary: There were 3 of us, one adult 2 kids. We were given 1 king bed for the price of $134 for 2 nights, tax fees included. Super cheap but it came with uncomfortable stay.   My son got his allergy back that triggered his asthma attack on the first night. It means the place is dusty.   The fan the heater/AC it too strong, even the lowest setting. I was afraid it circulated the dust in the room in the air.   The bathroom is renovated but the shower got very steamy, until the whole floor got wet the whole time, your feet got wet every time you enter the bathroom.  The soap crumbles when you open the wrapper. The house keeping did not do a good job. They left water marks, wet area on the table.

Terrible place.  Bed was very uncomfortable, no in room coffee, refidgerator froze everything. Noisy, noisy, noisy. Bathroom setup was very inconvenient.  Avoid at all cost. Television selection was almost non-existent.  Basically a very uncomfortable place to stay.  We were there to visit a dieing relative and staying here made it worse.

Poor Customer service, NO CABLE, (local channels only) NO PHONE SERVICE, I have to call from my cell phone to report about the cable,no closet. Pricey room for a LOUSY SERVICE AND DISGUSTING ROOM. Definatelly we Won't be back to this hotel.

Summary Heading: Disgusting, dirty, don't EVER stay here. They blamed it on Priceline.
Summary: This was the worst motel we have ever stayed in. It was dirty, moldy, decrepit, smelly; shower was burning hot or ice cold. Had to cover the spread with a sheet. It did not deserve a spoke on a star. The tiny cake of soap broke after one use. The towels were like rags. When we complained that the pictures did not represent their place, they said it was the fault of Priceline. Give me a break! Priceline does not go out and do pictures.

This hotel had 2 1/2 stars and was over by at least 2 stars!! The rooms were tiny and dirty and poor quality beds!  The bathrooms were dirty and moldy in the cracks and the toilet had a slow leak!  The people hanging around the outside were a little suspicious! I didn't do enough research, I suggest you STAY AWAY!!!!

Summary Heading: Don't stay here unless you have to
Summary: My boyfriend and I came to LA for a week for a vacation and the place that we were staying before we got to key inn didn't work out and while being tight on money I searched places with a AAA discount and came across key inn. The front desk staff was very nice and easy to work with. We got our room key and everything was great. Until we turned the fan on and the room began to smell like urine. Once we turned the A/C on the smell went away. Then after sleeping for a night the bottom sheet came down and there were 2 huge urine stains on the mattress. Then the night before we left the neighbors next to us were up all night fighting and banging on the walls. If I had more money I would not have ever stayed at this place.

Decent sized rooms, however despite the no smoking in rooms signs a very strong smell of Smoke in my room. Also a smell of Urine in the corridor outside the room. Also combined bath/shower heavily scratched and rust marks around drain. Towels heavily used, and stained. In short you get what you pay for.
Manager Response: Dear Glenn. I want to thank you very much for your time spent on your review, also for staying with us and giving us the opportunity of hosting you at our location. I'm sorry for the inconvenience you experienced at the facility, we're taking the necessary steps to make sure this negative aspects are not reflected within our property, we'll make sure that this does not keep happening to the rest of our guests.

Summary: This hotel seems like it's trying to improve by updating the rooms. I'll give them credit for that. The room design is not bad and it seemed pretty clean except for smelling like cigarettes. For the price compared to other hotels in the area, I think this place is a good value for what they charge. There seemed to be some shady looking characters around the place, so I was a little wary of that. The only thing I can think they could do to improve the stay would be to reform the bedding. I found the pillows, sheets and blankets to be very scratchy and uncomfortable. Maybe add some mattress pads and new bedding. Overall, I think if you are looking to save money and if you are not picky about bedding, this place is ok. Also, I like the design of the larger rooms with upstairs and

Horrible hotel glad I was only in it to sleep. Nothing good to say about it , the non smoking room smelled of smoke. The shower was cracked and chipping away the shower head was full of lime and rusty. Feet got dirty walking in the carpet this place is in need of some renovations.

Summary Heading: Had to get a nights rest away from broken AC
Summary: So my AC broke down and while I was getting it repaired I had to get a nights rest here.   Ok worst place on the planet? Maybe not. But man is this place bad, they charged me 89 dollars for a single bed single room no amenities and I should've just coughed up the 20 extra to go to a residence inn Marriott but I was so tired and lazy I just couldn't. Shame on me, I contributed to the lack thereof service here.   Stay away travelers, you have been warned!

Real good value for money, near by good restaurants, indian chinese, wine shops,  Pros's  1.on highway still not noisy 2. Friendly staff 3. clean rooms and good amenities 4. micro wave, fridge, ironing table all working well, 5. clean toilets,  Con's 1. no much channel to watch.   book throgh booking.com and got good price

Older motel with good amenities like a refrigerator.  Good beds.  Wonderful landscaping to look out upon.  Efficient front-desk staff person upon check-in.  We booked last minute looking for places in Orange County $100 or less.

Summary Heading: Week end visit to Tustin and family
Summary: We come to Tustin every year the weekend after Thanksgiving. We came and stayed here. It was very misleading. We asked for non smoking room, but we got a room that smelled very smokey. When I tried to let someone know we were told no other rooms available. The room was  small, smelley, carpet was fithy and worn. I would not stay there again if they paid me.  Loud and rude people, noisy and loud party in the pool.  Tried to call security, never got an answer. We were to stay 2 nights but we left after 1 night. The pictures and brochures are not what they say or show to be. We came outside and stood on the balcany for a few minutes and could see people buying and selling drugs. Drinking in the pool and smoking and no thought for other guests. We still come to Tustin and go to the

This hotel has a deceiving exterior appearance.  The rooms say remodeled but the rug is old, dirty, and smells.  We had to fog our room because we kept finding ants and spiders in random corners.  We also ended up checking out and asking for a refund because we would get attacked by huge flying roaches every night as we would try to get into our room.  Staff had a very poor attitude and really didn't care and even said, "Well, they're Not inside the room, they're outside" and didn't do anything to correct the issue.  AC's also shut off and on all night and have no feature for constant fan.
Manager Response: Dear Guest. I understand how frustrated you must feel with all these issues during your stay at our property. I'm very sorry for all the terrible experience you had with us. Rest assure that we'll solve these negative aspects of our property to bring it back to your expectations. Thank you for staying with us.

Summary Heading: It was great for two nights, the it went down hill
Summary: Thanks Yelp, but even when I spoke with the Owner/Manager named: George, he and his staff still chose to do "Nothing" to bring a positive resolution to a less than pleasant stay. I stayed here for a total of Nine Days. The first room was alright, considering that I had to get some Carpet orderizer. The second and third room, before my early check out from my planned Weekly rate that I paid had its issues too.  Cockroaches and broken bathroom items, such as the Soap Dish in the Shower area of a Disabled accommodated bathroom. I have the pictures to prove it. After my second day here there were numerous issues such as: People having a party, with excessive noise well after 11:00 pm and that is outside of the rooms in the promenade area. Plus! Other hotel guests that would be

This was the worst hotel experience I've ever had.  Upon entering, the door lock kept getting stuck and every time we entered we had to repeatedly reinsert the card until the door would open.  A lamp was broken and did not work.  My kids wanted to swim in the pool and did so for about ten minutes, when some adults decided it was time to drink and smoke weed by the pool, with no regard of who was around and the pool was located right in front of the office and nobody would say anything to them!  But the worst part was that at 1 in the morning, there was a party going on upstairs and they were loud and drinking.  I called to complain and asked if security would tell them to stop.  Two hours later, the party continued and my family was unable to sleep untl 4 in the morning, when I

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Went to Disneyland for their 24-hour event, and decided on this last minute and most of the hotels close by were booked. Heard about this hotel from a friend. Pricing was inexpensive and my friend recommended it so my boyfriend and I stayed at this place. When we first arrived (about 9/10pm on Thursday night), we waited about 10-15 mins to check in because the receptionist was making a personal phone call to someone (she actually admitted it and apologized). The room was fine, except that we asked for a non-smoking room and it smelled entirely like smoke. Other than that the bed was comfy, the fridge was clean, and the room itself was overall clean (bathroom was clean too, but remember to take your own towels!). The drive to Disneyland was quick. But parking at the hotel was a

Summary Heading: Armando Robles is the glue that keeps me coming back to enjoy the value of The Key Inn & Suites
Summary: I can be a high maintenance traveler from time to time. This little trip landed me with an unexpected motorhome in my lap. I thought I was in a real jam because it had no license plates on it because it came from a local auction. Armando made an exception and let me keep it on the property while I stayed here.... SAVED MY LIFE! I'm so grateful! I highly recommend this property if you are looking for reasonable people at an unbeatable price.

staff was nice big plus. rooms are average size room and clean. its a no thrill stay which is fine, when you need a quiet place to stay. you are not far from lots of fast food places. The only thing i would like them too upgrade their towels, sandpaper is nicer.

Summary Heading: It works if you're a cheap, no frills kind of person
Summary: I was able to book a queen room at the last minute for a trip to Disneyland for New Years Eve. For it being NYE, I secured a decent price. Even before I checked in, I was provided with some really good customer service. I had called at around 3PM on the day of my check in to let the manager, Rocio, know that I was planning to actually come around 2AM in the morning. She noted it down on my reservation so when 2AM came around and I got to the hotel to check in, everything went smoothly. This hotel is about a 15 minute drive away from Disneyland, and it's pretty convenient if you have your own car to get to the parks and don't mind the drive. The location is right off Highway 5, and near some fast food restaurants and gas stations. I'm sure there's a Walmart in the nearby

I called your office, left the hotel. I want my money back. the rooms sheet smelled like sex and sweat. Two of the staff were deciding how they were going to call of the next day discussing how overworked they were. I would not recommend anyone stay there..its worse than Calcutta-its like you walked into a third world country the check in staff are old, bitter and cranky. I thought it was family owned..its as trashy as you can get. very disappointed this was even recommended from Expedia..when i informed Expedia staff the did nothing and very dismissive. Look like drug dealers and hookers hang out there.  RUN!!

Myself and my husband have been staying her for awhile and if it was not for Rocio the manger i dont know where we would be! Not only does she go out of her way to make your stay great but she always makes sure that all the guests are taken care of. Our room is always clean and if anything is needed the front desk makes sure it gets to us right away.    Rocio has maintained the property and has kept the riff raff out. Once you notify her of anyone that doesnt belong here she makes sure they are removed from the property. Key Inn should be very proud to have a manager like Rocio representing them!!!!! We can not say enough about Rocio and her employees!!!!   THANK YOU ROCIO AND ARMANDO!! Robert and Jennifer Hernandez

This is a value hotel that was ok for the most part. We had booked a room but had to switch to another shortly after getting settled. Had issues with the first room. The second room we stayed in had some serious pressure in the bathroom lol, every time I flushed the toilet, it felt like being in an airplane bathroom. Take a huge **** and it will be gone within seconds hahahaha. Sorry but it was that serious. Tub could have used a little fixing in the room we moved to (the first room must have been the "renovated" one but the pressure was very good. Might stay here again if something is quickly needed. Lots of stores in the surrounding area, starbucks and wendys across the street. I feel indifferent about this hotel so yeah.

I stayed here last night on a business trip.  The room was older but clean.  There's a large flat screen TV, fridge, and microwave in the room.  The WiFi is a bit slow.  There are 7-8 restaurants nearby with a Denny's next door.

Summary Heading: Manager Rocio is a bitter Mexican lady with no respect!!
Summary: I had a lot of trouble with this place. Bugs, thugs, riffraff, meth heads and that wasn't the worst. The tv does not work and when speaking to the pretend manager Rocio I have come to find out she is a rude bitter lady with no respect or customer service. I think she should be fired. She curses and can't even speak without raising her voice. I have reported her to corp. and I have asked for my money back as this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed!

Summary Heading: Great place for long term stay!
Summary: I've been staying at the Key Inn for well over a year.The staff here is always friendly and courteous, and treat you like family. The rates are the best south of Anaheim, especially considering the rooms have 37" flat screen TV's.   The rooms are clean, the landscape is beautiful, and there is a pool for both buildings.All in all, this is a great hotel and I would tell anyone who asked to stay here.
Manager Response: Dear Joshman380,  Thank you so much for your wonderful review. I am so glad to read that you have continued to be a loyal guest for well over a year now. Our location is perfect for any type of visit. We are centrally located to plenty of great beaches, shopping and dining, and even major theme park attractions such as Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm.   Thank you again for your continued service and even more for your awesome review!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales  Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: Don't judge a book by its cover
Summary: As you know everyone has their own opinion on hotels/motels and they are not always the same.  Our experience at The Key Inn has always been a great one. The general manager Armando Robles is wonderful on making ours and maybe your stay a pleasant one.  The staff are great!  They always do their very best to accommodate your needs. My daughter and I go to Disneyland a lot and its just a short 10-15min drive from The Key Inn. We have mostly stayed in one of the best rooms which is 101.  It's perfect for just the 2 of us, has a large closet, and a small kitchen area that has a counter with sink,microwave,fridge,coffee maker and small table for our stays longer than 2-days.  If we have more than just the 2 of us then I suggest the Tower Suite.  It is more money but its worth it!
Manager Response: Dear Lv2otrval,  Wow, what an informative review! First and foremost, thank you for being such a loyal customer to the Key Inn & Suites. It is clear that you are very familiar with our property and the surrounding area. Thank you for mentioning some of our local restaurants such as Denny’s, Wendy’s and Subway. We are also located adjacent to Shell and Mobil gas station.   I am proud to see that the staff continues to accommodate all of your needs. Rest assured that the team will be acknowledged for all of their hard work along with Armando Robles.  I am more than positive we will be expecting a visit from you very soon.  Until then, greetings to the Bay Area!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary: For Orange County, the rooms here are very inexpensive, but still fairly large and well kept. The location is so-so, and the rooms don't keep out a lot of the noise from people walking and talking in the outside corridor, but it does have convenient access to several restaurants and fast food places (I recommend the funnel cake place on the other side of Red Hill). One thing that is a bit off-putting is the security plastic separating you from the desk clerks. That always makes me feel like I'm on the wrong side of the glass, and makes me wonder about the neighborhood.
Manager Response: Dear technicat,  Thank you for your review on your stay with us. We take great pride in making sure we accommodate all of our guests needs. For guests who are more sensitive to noise than others, we always encourage requests to a quiet location.   Rest assured, we are located in a safe and convenient location. With us being in such a close proximity to the freeway, it acts as a convenient and accessible location.   We always extend the invitation to return to our property!  “Suite” Regards,  Kimberly Rosales Social Media Manager

Summary Heading: If you're not in Anaheim, it's worth the price
Summary: This hotel is conveniently just off the freeway, close to many eating places, and pretty centrally located to major attractions. The rooms are pretty basic (I do take the bedspread off the bed--they look a bit questionable) but overall, very clean and quiet. I've stayed here 4 times and have never had a problem.

Summary Heading: Cheap, small rooms, but great rates.
Summary: No ammenities, but the staff are quite polite. Most rooms u can park right in front of ur door. Cable is limited, and the rooms are very small, but they'll do for an overnight stay or road break. One thing that kept happening to me, and I think it was just bad luck, someone kept calling our room at odd hours. Id answer, they wouldn't say anything then hang up.

Great location right off the exit ramp to the freeway.  There were food places close by (Denny's next door), along with gas and convenience stores. There was not alot of parking and I had a large limousine bus I parked next door at the parking lot. The place is older and shows it's age.  However, it seemed clean and maintained(very much like a motel 6 or super 8 budget motel.  It did have a seperate bedroom from the main bedroom (I guess they call this a suite) but, it did not have a table w/chairs. Basic no frills hotel.

Summary Heading: 2 year resident, no complaints, often refer family and friends.
Summary: The staff is very polite, the rooms are very clean, the environment is friendly. If you ever need a place to stay away from home that cost efficient, the key inn is my personal recommendation.
The rooms are clean and the staff is very good. Near disneyland and orange county airport. Plenty of good places to dine.

I am a professional/business owner who resides in LA county, and with rental properties in Orange, and San Diego counties. One who travels(for business) to and fro the north and south of California. I have always found this place a great  refuge to relax. This place is clean, affordable, and with cordial staff, and professional management. Considering today's high fuel prices, and snarl traffic of LA county, I found it more feasible to stay at Key Inn when I am in town.

Located right off the highway makes the Key Inn really accessible to both L.A., San Diego and Anaheim (Disney Land!!) However this means you can hear the traffic all night. The staff were ok, not fantastic but were quick and efficient. There was a pool but it was too cold to use it. However it did look clean and well cared for.   Best thing- Right next to Dennys!  Worst thing- The beds were SO small!

Summary Heading: Clean room but don't expect anything more!
Summary: We stayed one night at this hotel based on the trip advisor rating and we were rather surprised with the number one rating, boy were we surprised! Although the room was rather dated, it was clean; although the clean sheet did have stains. The room was bare of any of the normal amenities that one would expect, like a clock, a hair dryer, a coffee pot or an ice bucket. The neighborhood did cause me some concern that our truck would still be there in the morning--it was. Now on the plus side, the desk ladies were very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is right next door to a Denny's making breakfast easy. There is also a very pretty  garden area between the buildings. And, most importantly was the price, we paid $49 for the night, so, how much more can you expect from a hotel
Loved the hotel very nice workers. Very clean I would recommend this to anyone going solo or with family.

Upon my recent return to Tustin, I needed affordable extended stay housing for my son and I. Reluctantly, I checked in to the Key Inn. I say reluctantly because as a 40+ year resident of Tustin, the Key Inn did not have the best reputation in years past. however, I am confident and comfortable in saying that this bad reputation can now be put to rest.  While the Key Inn is known for low budget lodging, I have experienced a high level of quality, friendly and present customer service from the staff at the front desk, maintenance, housekeeping and the GM himself.  My room is cleaned and stocked daily with fresh linens, towels, soaps, shampoos, lotions etc...The grounds are well kept and well lit at night. The guests come from all over and for many reasons and all those I have met

OK The meids, the manager, at the chekin, wow, just frendly people, they make just the grate dial, the rooms are clean, The service in general is amasing, Just the comfortable, place to spend, your vacations, Just next to everything, frwy, shopping centers, just nameit, and is very close. 2 pools very clean,

I have stayed at the Key Inn and Suites many times over the past nine months, and have always had a clean, comfortable room and bed, great service from the staff including management and line employees, and awesome television reception and well-functioning air conditioning/heating. This latest stay is no exception.  In these tough times, it is good to be able to stay on an extended trip and save. The hotel gives a fourth night free with three nights' paid stay. For the cost of a lower-end motel, you get the comfort and convenience of a two-and-a-half star. Some rooms have a microwave and refrigerator, good for the business or family traveler who wants to economize. If you need to be in the center of Orange County, CA, with all of its attractions and business opportunities, Key
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your comment. The Key Inn Team is working harder every day on all the different aspects of the property to make your stay more comfortable. We appreciate your continue support.

Summary: I have stayed here for a while for business reasons and for the price, facilities and service -- you wont find better.  The place runs with "resort" level detail and the staff and security is friendly, professional and helpful and their incredible attention to detail makes them their best asset.    Inspite of what I have been reading here, from my experience the rooms/beds are just fine and the rooms are definetly not dirty.  You can even request to get a fridge and microwave if you need them.  The internet is a little slow but I have seen them doing so much work around here, its hard to believe they have enough people staying to make it happen.  Just this week they completely repaved the parking lot.  The site even has a laundry facility for guests to use.  The best part of
Manager Response: Thank you for taken the time to write a review. Your comments are appreciated.

Summary: Well worth the price. This place is nothing like the reviews in 2007. I have stayed here over four weeks and will be returning. For the price, I could not ask for better. The grounds were always clean and my room cleaned daily. The General Manager was working diligently to upgrade the rooms and seemed to care about the space and service delivered. My room was child proof (furniture rounded corners - added bonus) with new carpet. The maintenance crew, very friendly and respectful. Reception had several staff members working, I chose to work with the same staff member whom I thought was the friendliest. I was a little nervous at first of the location since it was not with all the other hotels. I was more nervous because of the bad reviews. I am relieved to say, I have been here

Hello . We have stayed at the Key inn a few times in the last 6 months . It is not a high priced hotel but well worth the money spent . We have stayed in years past and it was not very good at all. Something changed reciently and has got allot better . With the 5 freeway close and Dennys right there it is very  convenient .

My visit to the Key Inn was a delightfull one.  The staff was pleasant and helpful from the beginning.  The room accomodations met all my requirements.  The prices were great and I will surely be back for another visit.

Summary Heading: Dirty, Filthy, Blood On Sheets Don't Stay!!
Summary: This was horrible. My mother and I were there for all but 3 hours. Dirty and mediocre room. Bedtime we pulled the comforter to find all this blood that hadn't been cleaned on the inside of the comforter. Hotel employees didn't care, very rude. Took them 20 minutes to send someone to change the sheets. We packed up and left. Went through hell to get refund. Luckily had American Express. Don't stay here. 2 miles away there are plenty of hotels near the airport. Much nicer and a variety of hotels and prices.   I sent letter with the photos I took of the blood to all parties to complain and take their hotel off sites such as Hotels.com.  TRUST ME....DONT STAY HERE!! UNSAINITARY AND DISTGUSTING.

Summary Heading: There has GOT to be a better place to stay.
Summary: This place was abominable.  The first Non-Smoking room they tried to give us was utterly uninhabitable...and it sure seemed as if someone had been smoking (a lot) in the room within the past hour.  The second room they gave us was BARELY habitable...and had a totally and completely non-functional air conditioning unit.  The furniture, fixtures and equipment would charitably be described as "tired."  The room was loud.  If there were something positive to say about the place I would.  OK:  it was the only place I could find availability within 20 miles of where I had to be.  All things considered maybe I should have stayed at home.  MAG

(1) Pros       Close to Interstate 5.  Although it was right next to Freeway, room was quiet.    (2) Cons       My son's Polo Shirt and pants were missing and the staff did not do anything but say that their staff would not touch customers' stuff.  My wife's one-piece cloth were missing also.  Again, they did not do anything.        Room carpet was so dirty that we had to wear shoes ALL the time.         According to their own web-site, the rooms had kitchen but it was mis-leading.  Some rooms had kitchen.   Here is link to there web-stie:    [--]
